content: In the city of Stenograd, where life is shaped by the invisible hand of the Behavioral Compliance Index, chaos stirs after its architect, Marek Halden, dies mysteriously and the system starts to fail. Fearing loss of control, Nikola Petrak of the Directorate authorizes a harsh crackdown on citizen gatherings trying to save their own records and build alternative networks, while technicians begin shutting down the city’s core functions. As confusion spreads, Rada and her fellow activists work through the night to salvage everyone’s data and spark the rise of transparent, citizen-run scoring systems. These shadow BCIs rapidly take root, drawing thousands eager for fairness and truth, and as the old regime fragments, the people finally confront the city’s hidden abuses—stepping into a future where control slips from silent algorithms into the hands of those who once had none.
